intro: Cryptantha limensis, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. Cryptantha limensis is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, drought-prone conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
